page.title: 10CHURCHES IN CATERHAM PAGE 1
page.content: {ST. LAWRENCES CHURCH } St. Lawrences church was built in 1095. It is made of flint, Godstone stone, bricks and tiles. There was a wooden church there in{SAXON TIMES.}In 1230 the north aisle was added. It has two bells made in 1664 by John Hodson. There is one Norman Window. There is said to be a plague pit in the churchyard. More people came to live in Caterham when the railway was built in 1856. St. Lawrences church was too small and so a new church was built. { {ST. MARY'S CHURCH} St. Mary's Church was built in 1866 opposite St. Lawrences Church. In 1883 the spire was built and so was the south aisle. { }
